paragraph258: Linear Power Amplifier 204F-1 is a three-stage, linear power amplifier that is designed to amp­
paragraph259: lify low-power radio frequency signals from an associated exciter unit to a level suitable for trans­ mission from an antenna. The 204F-1 is primarily intended for single sideband operation, but can
paragraph260: be used with any type of input signal that does not exceed its bandwidth and power capabilities. The
paragraph261: amplifier may be switched to either of two channels, and either channel may be tuned to any fre­ quency between 2 and 30 megacycles. The 204F-1 is capable of delivering either 2. 5 kilowatts peak envelope or 2. 5 kilowatts average power continuously. It can be operated locally or
paragraph264: Linear Power Amplifier 204F-1 is contained in a single cabinet, which described in paragraph 1. 5.

paragraph1316: Linear Power Amplifier 204F-l is designed for either attended or unattended operation. Power
paragraph1318: can be controlled locally or remotely. All power supply
paragraph1319: circuits are equipped with protective devices that prevent damage to the equipment or injury to
paragraph1320: operating personnel. Either of two complete sets of tuned circuits may be selected by relay action.
paragraph1321: Each set of tuned circuits may be tuned to any frequency in the range
paragraph1323: Each set of tuned circuits must be pretuned to the desired frequency. Variable capacitors, tapped coils, and padding capacitors are provided in each set of tuned circuits.
paragraph1328: The operation of Linear Power Amplifier 204F-l involves
paragraph1329: the use of high voltages that could be fatal. Under no
paragraph1330: circumstances should any person reach within the cabinet
paragraph1331: without the immediate presence of another person w ho is
paragraph1332: capable of rendering aid. Do not depend on interlocks or
paragraph1333: shorting switches. Always use the high voltage shorting

paragraph1506: The linear power amplifier contains two complete sets of tuned circuit components in the input
paragraph1507: amplifier stage, driver amplifier stage, and in the output network. Selection of one set of com­
paragraph1510: ponents in each amplifier stage and the output various relays involved are controlled by the CHANNEL A-CHANNEL B switch. Hence, the two sets of components are referred to
paragraph1511: as the channel J\ and channel B circuits.. Each set of com-
paragraph1512: network is accomplished through relay action. The
paragraph1514: ponents may be tuned to any frequency in the range between 2 and 30 megacycles. Continuously
paragraph1515: variable capacitors, tapped coils, and padding capacitors are provided to cover this freque ncy
paragraph1516: range. A guide to the setting of the variable capacitors, setting of the taps on the coils, and
paragraph1517: amount of padding capacity required for a given frequency is presented in the form of a tuning
paragraph1518: chart that is fastened to the rear surface of the lower hinged panel on the upper cabinet door.

paragraph1826: The linear power amplifier is equipped with several protective devices that are designed to pre­
paragraph1827: vent injury to the equipment and operating personnel. These devices can be bypassed by a skilled
paragraph1828: technician, but should not be disabled unless absolutely necessary. The 204F-1 may be operated
paragraph1829: with the lower cabinet door open for purposes of maintenance, but should not be operated under any

paragraph1854: Linear Power A m plifier 204F-1 is a three stage linear power amplifier that is d esigned to amplify
paragraph1855: radio frequency signals of approximately one-tenth watt amplitude to a level of 2. 5 kilowatts and
paragraph1856: deliver this power to an associated antenna for transmission. Either of two operating frequencies,
paragraph1857: which are in the range between 2 and 30 megacycles, can be selected. Channel changing is accom­
paragraph1858: plished by switching with relays between two sets of tuned circuits in each stage. Each channel is
paragraph1859: capable of being tuned to any frequency within the range of the equipment. All necessary operating
paragraph1860: voltages are developed within the equipment from an external source
paragraph1863: and a variety of protective devices provide a maximum of protection with a minimum
paragraph1864: of complexity. An integral blower unit is provided to maintain the equipment at the p roper operating

paragraph3037: Most troubles can be isolated by observing and properly analyzing: (1) the response, or lack thereof,
